intro: Masdevallia cyathogastra, commonly known as the Ecuadorian masdevallia, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate, often colorful floral structures. The plant typically features long, slender leaves and produces flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple. It thrives in cool, humid environments with high light exposure. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
